item.title: A novel tool for the future of heart repair
item.author: Caroline Wolfe,
item.description: Heart attacks cause the heart to be temporarily starved of blood flow and oxygen due to a blockage in the coronary arteries, which deliver oxygen-rich blood to the heart. This blockage leads to scar tissue within the heart. As we age, this damage is often deemed irreversible due to the heart’s …

item.title: The Hidden Danger of Sneezing!
item.author: Caroline Wolfe,
item.description: Everyone has someone in their life with an obnoxiously loud sneeze that he or she wishes they would at least try to stifle. As it turns out, stifling sneezes by pinching the nose shut with the mouth closed can actually be dangerous. Doctors at the Department of Head and Neck Surgery at the …

item.title: Are robots the future of tissue regeneration?
item.author: Caroline Wolfe,
item.description: The applications of robots span many disciplines – far beyond what one might see on BBC’s Robot Wars. Robots themselves have long had several applications in the medical field, but only recently have researchers demonstrated the effectiveness of their use for tissue regeneration. At Boston’s …
